alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 10:23PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Cumberland and Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Coos and Grafton. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Bartlett, Lovell, Jackson, Albany, Chatham, Stowe, and Hart`s Location. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
